dataList.dlg: Another start to a joyful day, huh? ... Uh, gimme a sec to check the volume. I can't hear your response.
Just focus on my voice, everyone! I'm here to help!
It's not good... I'm seeing a lot of wounded people. But that's okay! Control Team is more than capable of handling something like this, right?
I'm sure everyone's struggling. But I firmly believe that every employee here is willing to give their best, ready to give their lives for this!
The suppression target is staggered. This is our opportunity to make sure it'll never move a finger again!
The entity is struggling. Let's take this chance to suppress it completely!
That's okay, mistakes happen all the time. I know I'm slower than others, so I used to write everything down on my notepad. Just don't lose your will.
If you see any employees saying that they can't take it anymore... Lemme know, okay?
Woah, we did it! Look, the entity's stopped moving. Let's permanently immobilize the other ones, too.
One of the employees has stopped moving. Huh? What's with that look on everybody? Are we getting weak-willed employees already? Just because of this?
The enemies have the upper hand. Maybe we should have a co-department training session for a few days? Everyone uh... changes a lot after going through training!
We have the upper hand. But let's not rest easy just yet. Control Team has to be perfect from start to finish, don't you agree?
That's okay. My notebook here has instructions on what to do for all situations. Looks like we might have to make some necessary sacrifices!
A powerful attack's coming. Now that I've warned you, I better not see any employees failing to get out of its way in time!
Looks like they're preparing for a special attack. We can be ready for that, right?
That attack was effective. You should try that again!
That wasn't very effective. Did any of you not read the manuals beforehand, by any chance?
That was an effective attack. But not nearly enough. Let's make our next strike even better!
See, everyone? That was not an appropriate attack. Was it the lack of care... or the lack of effort?
Looks like the entities have a slight advantage. But not to worry. We'll still try our best, right?
They're at a slight disadvantage. We can use that to tip this battle in our favor.
We gained an advantage. Nice!
Looks like an employee is suffering from something. Don't let something so trivial as this weaken your teammates' will, okay? Let's all take care of each other!
A part's been broken off. At this pace, we'll break every single one of its parts.
See? A part's been broken off. Let's keep breaking and tearing its parts away, and we should be able to suppress it in no time.
You broke the entity's part. Let's make sure its demise is a slow and painful one, how's that?
Woah, that must've been extremely painful. Let's return that very same pain and hatred against our enemies.
I see a lot of our employees in pain. Don't worry, though. As long as I'm the one leading the Control Team, we won't fail. ... Failure is unacceptable.
The entities are suffering from critical damage. Can't you feel their pain? Good, let's keep going.
That was a devastating strike against the target. The enemies are now weakened enough for us to deal a final blow!
Wow, that was an impressive attack! The manager will give us a positive review.
Nice to meet you! My name is Malkuth! I'm in charge of the Control Team at Lobotomy Corp. Headquarters! Just do exactly as I say, and I'm sure you will succeed!
